rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRT

classVariables.description: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.
classVariables.label: Name of Treatment
classVariables.name: --TRT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--MODIFY

classVariables.description: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
classVariables.label: Modified Treatment Name
classVariables.name: --MODIFY

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DECOD

classVariables.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of the topic variable, --TRT, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.
classVariables.label: Standardized Treatment Name
classVariables.name: --DECOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--SCAT

classVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PRESP

classVariables.description: Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.
classVariables.label: Pre-specified
classVariables.name: --PRESP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--OCCUR

classVariables.description: Used to record whether a pre-specified intervention occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
classVariables.label: Occurrence
classVariables.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--STAT

classVariables.description: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--REASND

classVariables.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--INDC

classVariables.description: Denotes the indication for the intervention (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered).
classVariables.label: Indication
classVariables.name: --INDC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLAS

classVariables.description: Class for a medication or treatment, often obtained from a coding dictionary.
classVariables.label: Class
classVariables.name: --CLAS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLASCD

classVariables.description: Used to represent code for --CLAS.
classVariables.label: Class Code
classVariables.name: --CLASCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSE

classVariables.description: Amount of --TRT given. Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.
classVariables.label: Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTXT

classVariables.description: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: <1 per day, 200-400. Not populated when --DOSE is populated.
classVariables.label: Dose Description
classVariables.name: --DOSTXT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSU

classVariables.description: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT (Examples: ng, mg, mg/kg).
classVariables.label: Dose Units
classVariables.name: --DOSU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRM

classVariables.description: Dose form for the treatment. Examples: TABLET, CAPSULE.
classVariables.label: Dose Form
classVariables.name: --DOSFRM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRQ

classVariables.description: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval. Examples: QD, BID, TID, QID.
classVariables.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
classVariables.name: --DOSFRQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTOT

classVariables.description: Total daily dose of --TRT using the units in --DOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose.
classVariables.label: Total Daily Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSTOT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSRGM

classVariables.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.
classVariables.label: Intended Dose Regimen
classVariables.name: --DOSRGM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ROUTE

classVariables.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.
classVariables.label: Route of Administration
classVariables.name: --ROUTE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOT

classVariables.description: Lot number for the intervention described in --TRT.
classVariables.label: Lot Number
classVariables.name: --LOT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOC

classVariables.description: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site. Example: RIGHT ARM for an injection.
classVariables.label: Location of Dose Administration
classVariables.name: --LOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRTV

classVariables.description: Vehicle for administration of treatment, such as a liquid in which the treatment drug is dissolved. Example: SALINE.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle
classVariables.name: --TRTV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMT

classVariables.description: Amount of the treatment vehicle administered or given.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
classVariables.name: --VAMT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMTU

classVariables.description: Units for the treatment vehicle. Examples: mL, mg.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
classVariables.name: --VAMTU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ADJ

classVariables.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples ADVERSE EVENT, INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE, NON-MEDICAL REASON.
classVariables.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
classVariables.name: --ADJ

description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2018-06-29)
label: Interventions Observation Class
name: Interventions
